name: Beginning Fiction Workshop
long_desc: In this writingintensive workshop students will be laserfocused on producing and polishing their own fiction. Well complement our workshops with readings from masters of short fiction and novels, with an eye on sharpening our own facility with dialogue, structure, and voice. Each student must be prepared to constructively critique and deconstruct herhis peers work, as well as actively contribute to class discussions about the elements of craft that undergird successful works of fiction. Each student will be expected to produce a portfolio of original writing short exercises originating from thematic prompts and a substantial story by the end of the semester.

custom_fields.goals:
To help students become better and more creative writers, and to help them read more deeply, with a better understanding of form.
To inspire you to create your own fiction, while deepening your analysis and appreciation of contemporary stories and novels.
To experiment with characterization, sense of place, point of view, plot, use of imagery, metaphor, and dialogue.
To help you Identify the progress you make as a result of disciplined writing practice.
custom_fields.key_topics: Narrative, Structure, Prose, Critical Thinking, Analysis, Close Reading
custom_fields.prerequisite_knowledge: Students should have taken Introduction to Fiction Writing or Survey of Forms: Fiction and received a B-grade or higher
custom_fields.assessment_structure: Written responses to readings, class discussion, self-reflection, critiques, revision based on comments given on student writing. Portfolio of student writing often presented at term's end.
custom_fields.learning_resources: A variety of short fiction will be provided by the professor
